text: Hello everyone, I was looking at the JuliaAstro repository and was quite interested in contributing to it. Can you point out some good first issues to start with?

elements.text: Hello everyone, I was looking at the JuliaAstro repository and was quite interested in contributing to it. Can you point out some good first issues to start with?

text: What are you interested in implementing? Some of our packages are very image processing based while others are more geometric and others are mostly statistical

elements.text: What are you interested in implementing? Some of our packages are very image processing based while others are more geometric and others are mostly statistical

text: I would be interested in image processing and statistical packages.

elements.text: I would be interested in image processing and statistical packages.

text:
unfortunately there’s no good “first issues” right now in that area, any PR would require more work than what I would consider a gentle entry

That being said, two concrete things that can be implemented are
1. Bad pixel correction methods for CCDReduction.jl
2. source detection methods for Photometry.jl
3. Box least squares periodogram (would be for a new package but I can make that quickly)
